text: In a well-ordered universe...
author: Morgan Matson

text: If you own this story you get to write the ending.
author: Brené Brown

text: It’s never overreacting to ask for what you want and need.
author: Amy Poehler

text: Between living and dreaming there is a third thing. Guess it.
author: Antonio Machado

text: Life is a dream from which we all must wake before we can dream again.
author: Robert Jordan

text: Life is hell, at some point we all just have to get used to it.
author: Alysha Speer

text: What can we see, read, acquire, but ourselves. Take the book, my friend, and read your eyes out, you will never find there what I find.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Wildflower; pick up your pretty little head,
author: Nikki Rowe

text: Imagination is a quality that was given to man compensate him from whats not. The sense of humor was given to console him from what is.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Life has no meaning, the moment you lose the illusion of being eternal.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: The longing for Paradise is man's longing not to be man.
author: Milan Kundera

text: On this road there are no godspoke men. They are gone and I am left and they have taken with them the world.
author: Cormac McCarthy

text: Do not live in the shadow of the masters for ever. Learn to live in the light of your soul. Life deserves full expression.
author: Amit Ray

text: Never stop just because you feel defeated. The journey to the other side is attainable only after great suffering.
author: Santosh Kalwar

text: There is something incredibly nostalgic and significant about the annual cascade of autumn leaves.
author: Joe L. Wheeler

text: So I would choose to be with you,
author: Billy Joel

text: Our lives were just beginning, our favorite moment was right now, our favorite songs were unwritten.
author: Rob Sheffield

text: Each of us is a unique strand in the intricate web of life and here to make a contribution.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: Life is doubt,
author: Miguel de Unamuno

text: People soon get tired of things that aren't boring, but not of what is boring.
author: Haruki Murakami

text: We are star stuff harvesting sunlight.
author: Carl Sagan

text: When mice run, cats give chase.
author: Rachel Vincent

text: I heard an airplane passing overhead. I wished I was on it.
author: Charles Bukowski

text: Most people gaze neither into the past nor the future; they explore neither truth nor lies. They gaze at the television.
author: Radiohead

text: You have succeeded in life when all you really WANT is only what you really NEED.
author: Vernon Howard

text: Don't dwell on things. Don't stay in one place too long. It was the only way to stay ahead of sadness.
author: Rick Riordan

text: We are the sum of all people we have ever met; you change the tribe and the tribe changes you.
author: Dirk Wittenborn

text: Simplify, simplify.
author: Henry David Thoreau
